intro: Guettarda tobagensis var. tobagensis, commonly known as the Toba guettarda, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections in tropical regions.
